metadata.title: CVE-2015-3202 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
fusermount in FUSE before 2.9.3-15 does not properly clear the environmentbefore invoking (1) mount or (2) umount as root, which allows local usersto write to arbitrary files via a crafted LIBMOUNT_MTAB environmentvariable that is used by mount's debugging feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fuse - 2.9.2-4ubuntu4.14.04.1
libfuse2 - 2.9.2-4ubuntu4.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fuse package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.2-4ubuntu4.14.04.1').
